result.execSummary:
The defendant Zachary A Donoian was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: as a Party to a Crime], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: pay in full by 10/30/15 or 1 day jail for each $25 outstanding

huber (when eligible on 14CM526 def's other file)
Consecutive to: to any other sentence

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Zachary A Donoian

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Exparte Letter from Defendant.   Scanned and forwarded to Branch 2 for review.

Defendant Zachary A Donoian in court with attorney Daryl W Laatsch.  Defendant in custody. Jeffrey A. Sisley appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Complaint read, defendant advised of penalties.  Defendant entered plea of no contest.  Court accepts plea, finds the defendant guilty and renders sentence.
Conditions set by court:  Court orders absolute sobriety.  No possession/consumption of any intoxicants. No contact with victim TB

Defendant Zachary A Donoian in court in custody with attorney Rachel Marie Alme-Boaz.  Jeffrey A. Sisley appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant appears by video conferencing from Ozaukee County Jail.   Defendant waived reading of the complaint. Def does qualify for public defender. Def currently on PO hold at this time. State requests $500 signature bond with no contact conditions.  Plea hearing scheduled for February 3, 2015 at 10:00 am.
